de.htw.berlin.polysun4diac.plugins

Class AbstractSensorController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.velasolaris.plugin.controller.spi.AbstractPluginController
      • de.htw.berlin.polysun4diac.plugins.Abstract4diacPluginController
        • de.htw.berlin.polysun4diac.plugins.AbstractSingleComponentController
          • de.htw.berlin.polysun4diac.plugins.AbstractSensorController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPluginController
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BatterySensorController, GenericSensorController, LoadSensorController, PVSensorController

    public abstract class AbstractSensorController
extends AbstractSingleComponentController
    Defines the default behaviour of a FORTE sensor plugin controller for sending data to IEC 61499 applications running on 4diac-RTE (FORTE).
    Author:
    Marc Jakobi

    HTW Berlin

    July 2017

    • Method Detail

      • getConfiguration

        public com.velasolaris.plugin.controller.spi.PluginControllerConfiguration getConfiguration(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parameters)
                                                                                     throws com.velasolaris.plugin.controller.spi.PluginControllerException
        Description copied from interface: IPluginController
        Configuration of this plugin controllers. E.g. the properties in the controller setting GUI, the sensors, the log values and the signals to control. This method is called when the plugin controller in Polysun is created and every time when the variant is reloaded.
        Parameters:
        parameters - Generic parameters
        Returns:
        Plugin controller configuration. null sets a default configuration.
        Throws:
        com.velasolaris.plugin.controller.spi.PluginControllerException - if there is a problem creating the plugin controller configuration.

      • control

        public int[] control(int simulationTime,
                     boolean status,
                     float[] sensors,
                     float[] controlSignals,
                     float[] logValues,
                     boolean preRun,
                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parameters)
              throws com.velasolaris.plugin.controller.spi.PluginControllerException
        Description copied from interface: IPluginController
        Does the control work. This method is called each timestep by Polysun if signals must be controlled according to the sensor values.
        Parameters:
        simulationTime - The simulation time in [s] beginning from the 1. January 00:00 (no leap year).
        status - The status of this controller according to user settings, true means enabled, false disabled. The status originates from the timer setting of the controller dialog. The user can enable or disable the controller for certain hours, days or month. This value should be respected by the controller implementation, otherwise it could lead to an unexpected user experience.
        sensors - The values of the sensors configured by the user (Input parameter).
        controlSignals - The control signals set by this plugin controller (Output parameter).
        logValues - The values to log in Polysun, e.g intermediate results. This value can be ignored. These values are shown in the Simulation Analysis or in the Log and Parameterizing output.
        preRun - Is this the real simulation or a pre run phase? This value can be ignored.
        parameters - Generic parameters
        Returns:
        Timepoints [s]. Registers these timepoints in the future, where the simulation have to do a timestep. It doesn't matter, if the same timepoint will be registered several times. Timepoint in the array is in seconds from the 1. Jan. 00:00, or null if no additional timesteps are required. These timesteps can be used for time based controlling strategies.
        Throws:
        com.velasolaris.plugin.controller.spi.PluginControllerException - if there is a problem. The simulation will be aborted.
